holidays.name: Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day
holidays.description: A solemn day commemorating the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941, which thrust the U.S. into World War II. Though serious, it‚Äôs a crucial moment in history observed yearly.
holidays.origin: Established in 1994 by Congress to honor those who died in the attack.
holidays.funFact: The attack on Pearl Harbor involved over 350 Japanese airplanes and lasted less than two hours.

holidays.name: Letter Writing Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the lost art of handwriting by sending a letter to someone special. It's a quirky antidote to emails and texts!
holidays.origin: Likely emerged as a modern initiative to revive personal communication through snail mail.
holidays.funFact: A handwritten letter is often treasured more than an email because it shows extra effort and care.

holidays.name: National Cotton Candy Day
holidays.description: Indulge your sweet tooth and enjoy the fluffy, sugary goodness of cotton candy‚Äîperfect for winter fairs and nostalgic treats.
holidays.origin: Origin unclear, but enjoyed as a fun foodie observance in the U.S.
holidays.funFact: Cotton candy was invented by a dentist, William Morrison, in 1897. Sweet irony!

holidays.name: National Biscuits and Gravy Day
holidays.description: Embrace the hearty Southern comfort food of biscuits smothered in creamy sausage gravy. A perfect cure for chilly December mornings.
holidays.origin: An American culinary celebration, particularly beloved in the Southern U.S.
holidays.funFact: Biscuits and gravy rose to popularity during the Great Depression as an affordable, filling breakfast.

holidays.name: Make a Gift Day
holidays.description: Get crafty and DIY a unique gift for someone special. It‚Äôs a charming way to show love during the holiday season with something handmade.
holidays.origin: A modern creative holiday encouraging personal touches during gift-giving season.
holidays.funFact: Handmade gifts often carry more sentimental value and are remembered longer than store-bought ones.
